text: general HR McMaster will become the
National Security Adviser
President Donald Trump finally has his
man after sacking his first choice for
national security advisor and then being
turned down by his second choice the
Trump administration will be hoping its
third time lucky I just like to say what
a privilege it is to be able to continue
serving our nation I'm grateful to you
for that opportunity and I look forward
to joining the national security team
and doing everything I can to advance
and protect the interests of the
American people thank you very much good
job despite President Trump proclaiming
last week that his administration is
running like a fine-tuned machine it has
looked very different from the outside
his original controversial pic for
national security adviser retired
Lieutenant General Michael Flynn was
forced to stand down for misleading the
vice president about conversations he'd
had with the Russian ambassador then
retired Vice Admiral Robert Harwood said
he couldn't take on the job for personal
reasons over the weekend the president
met with four candidates at his luxury
mera Lago estate in Florida before his
press secretary announced the news in
true Trump style on Twitter the
selection of general McMaster has been
widely commended in Washington
he served in Afghanistan and Iraq and is
seen as a soldier's soldier who tells it
as he sees it I think everybody is
concerned who is concerned about this
humanitarian catastrophe that's that is
unraveling here in the greater Middle
East and and of course you know the
grave security concerns associated with
this and in a really a conflict that is
I think characterized by a cycle a cycle
of of ignorance and a perpetuation of
ignorance by groups like daesh and using
that ignorance to foment hatred and that
hatred to justify violence it remains to
be seen just how much freedom the new
National Security Adviser will have as
he takes on one of his first challenges
smoothing over reported tensions between
the White House and the intelligence
community too late' Mazumdar BBC News
Washington
